Row.Text: Ayesha Altugle, the Alchemist of Dusk. Let your herbs, tinctures, and salves join your stubborn, upbeat resolve. Let them bolster your alchemy as you venture into the maw of the forgotten. Brave these ruins and their treacherous inhabitants. Claim the artifacts and knowledge buried deep within. Emerge equipped with both, and you shall lead your civilization into an era of prosperity.
Ayesha
Ayesha Altugle
I was never really big into meat, but I can't get enough of yours.

Ayesha is a young apothecary living in a small and secluded workshop with her elderly grandfather and younger sister Nio Altugle. She is talented in making all sorts of remedies and medications, which are very famously known across the country. Because she leads such a secluded life, Ayesha is a very naïve person, although very kind.

When she leaves on her journey, she is very eager to learn more about becoming an alchemist even though she knows very little about it. She is very keen to try new things, even if she is unsuccessful or unsure of herself. As her confidence grows, Ayesha gains knowledge and becomes a very powerful alchemist. She is known for her upbeat attitude and for never giving up on her goals, no matter how impossible or difficult they may seem.

After her grandfather dies, her young sister mysteriously disappears. After being fully abandoned, Ayesha struggles to move on with her life. Despite being faced with constant hardship, Ayesha tries to remain as upbeat as possible, and continues to run her family's workshop.

While visiting her sister's grave on the third anniversary of her disappearance, Ayesha sees a figure who looks nearly identical to her missing sister. A by-passing alchemist tells Ayesha that her sister is alive, but she will not be able to reach her with her own hands. This gives Ayesha a whole new hope that her sister may still be alive, and she sets out on an adventure to be reunited with Nio.
I'm Ayesha Altugle—apothecary, alchemist, and adventurer-archaeologist.
Would you like to join me for a picnic in the shade of the Altugle Herb Garden? I'll bring flower muffins and squash tea.
Let's.
Vierzeberg's walls loom tall and stolid, but inside, its sprawl is all so much vigor. From the stacks of Zweiteturm to my sister's pharmacy. Come see for yourself.
Are you in need of aid?
Oh, absolutely.
Gee, would you look at that? The gate's closed.
Several of my artefacts and treasures have found their way into a delegation. Please welcome them.
Sure!
Nope!
I'm out in search of dusty old ruins. Mind if I check yours for dust?
Super.
We can't synthesize until I figure out your traits.
Did you know that friendship is a potent cure-all? Here, take one.
Don't you feel better already?
This is bad for your health.
Ruins are jam-packed with traps, monsters, and bellyaches. Our odds are better together.
Remove your troops from my border. The sign clearly reads, "No walking in the flower garden."
A deal's a deal.
You catch more flies with honey. Do you have honey?
My, my. There's no remedy for your personality.
You're a disease for which there is no cure. A blight upon all lands and peoples. (Denounces You.)
Apothecaries know poisons, too.
You're a greedy, virulent weed, and for that, you must be uprooted.
This'll allow us to tend to the wounded.
Sure. Just wait right there while I finish synthesizing this Zeit Bomb.
This war can't apothe-carry on.
All I've helped, all I've seen, all the friends I've made... I've lived the best life I could. I hope you do, too.
Don't worry. It'll be okay. I have something for the pain.
Apothecary
Ayesha likes civilizations that harness nature's bounty by improving tiles, and dislikes those that do not.
I'm glad you scour the land for the tinctures and salves that benefit your people.
Your land teems with resources, yet you ignore their healing properties—to the detriment of your people.
